thread.title: Holder’s suspected killer linked to other shooting: sources
thread.title_full: Holder’s suspected killer linked to other shooting: sources - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Holder’s suspected killer linked to other shooting: sources
text:
GREGG VIGLIOTTI FOR NEW YORK DAILY NEWS Suspected cop killer Tyrone Howard, who was shot in the leg before being busted, has a long arrest history, according to police sources. Charges against him were pending Wednesday morning, cops said. The man accused of shooting a cop to death in East Harlem Tuesday night has an extensive criminal history - and was being sought in connection with another shooting when he killed Officer Randolph Holder, police sources said.
The gunman, identified by police sources as Tyrone Howard, 30, was wanted for questioning in an earlier shooting in the same neighborhood when he swapped shots with Police Officer Randolph Holder and his partner on a pedestrian overpass above the FDR Drive near 120th St. around 8:30 p.m., officials said.
During the exchange, Holder, a third-generation police officer whose family hails from Guyana, was shot in the forehead. The brave public housing cop later died at Harlem Hospital.
Howard was shot in the leg and remained at New York-Presbyterian Hospital Weill Cornell Wednesday morning.
NYPD Officer Randolph Holder was fatally shot in the forehead on a pedestrian overpass above the FDR Drive near 120th St. late Tuesday. NYPD COMMISSIONER MOURNS DEATH OF OFFICER RANDOLPH HOLDER
Charges against Howard were pending Wednesday morning, police said.
“They have a long way to go before they charge him,” a police source said.
Howard’s arrest history includes busts for assault, robbery, criminal trespass, public lewdness and conspiracy, officials said.
He’s also been arrested nine times on narcotics possession charges and two times for marijuana possession, according to police sources.
Details of the prior shooting that Howard was being sought for were not immediately disclosed.
Howard limped away from the shooting scene Tuesday and was arrested on E. 124th St.
Police Commissioner Bill Bratton said Tuesday night that three other men were taken into custody and were being questioned about their role in the shooting.
The FDR Drive remained closed between E. 96th St. and E. 125th St. Wednesday as cops continue to search for evidence.
Angus Mordant/for New York Daily News Police officers form a guard of honor for the fallen Holder, who died at Harlem Hospital. Ken Murray/New York Daily News Investigators search for evidence in the aftermath of Tuesday night's deadly shooting. Previous Next Enlarge ttracy@nydailynews.com
